resource.name: Sonoma County Sheriff's Office Incident Data
resource.description: Sheriff’s incident reports are generated after either of two events 1) a citizen has reported an event/crime and a deputy has substantiated that a report is necessary or 2) a deputy has witnessed an event/crime in progress. These incident reports represent a wide spectrum of law enforcement activity from informational reports to serious crime reports. For more information about this dataset please go to the About button and click on the Attachment. For an interactive map of this data, please visit: http://www.raidsonline.com/?address=4787%20Old%20Redwood%20Hwy%20Santa%20Rosa,%20CA.
columns_description: Date and time that the incident was reported to have taken place. For incidents such as burglary when there is a time range within which the incident occurred this is the first possible time the incident could have occurred.
This column contains geo-coordinates used for mapping.
Agency code of agency that wrote the incident report.
Agency that wrote the incident report including Sheriff's Office and contract city reports.
Location category for where the incident report occurred. In the case where multiple locations are reported only the first location will be displayed.
Unique identifier
Incident category for the type of incident reported.
Closest intersection to the location where the event was reported. Intersections are used to protect victims identities.
Sequential number assigned to the incident report.

Geographic area where the reported incident took place. Some unincorporated areas are given three character codes rather then full town names. Additionally city names do not imply that the report occurred within city limits, simply within a geographic area designated with that city name. Use the intersection or geographic coordinates to identify the incident location.
Date the data was uploaded into Socrata after incident approval.

resource.name: Sonoma County Sheriff's Office Arrest Data
resource.description: Each row of data represents an arrest or citation. Arrest charges are grouped together in the charge description column. Charge details are delimited by semicolons and charges are delimited by line breaks with multiple hyphens. Location information has been generalized to the nearest intersection.
columns_description: Agency that wrote the arrest report including Sheriff's Office and contract city arrests.
Reported city of residence of the arrested individual.
Sequential number assigned to the incident report. Can be used in combination with agency to link to incident data.
Perceived race of the arrested individual.
First name of the arrested individual.
Middle name of the arrested individual.
English description of the code violation (arrest charge) associated with each charge.
This column contains geo-coordinates used for mapping.
Closest intersection to the location where the arrest was reported. Intersections are used to protect victims identities.
Reported age of the arrested individual.

Geographic area where the reported arrest took place. Some unincorporated areas are given three character codes rather then full town names. Additionally city names do not imply that the report occurred within city limits, simply within a geographic area designated with that city name. Use the intersection or geographic coordinates to identify the approximate arrest location.
Last name of the arrested individual.
Sequential number assigned to the arrest report.
Disposition status of the arrested individual indicating if they were booked or cited and release.
Highest degree of significance for the overall arrest report, not specific to the individual charge.
Reported gender of the arrested individual.
Date and time that the arrest was reported to have occurred.
Reported street of residence of the arrested individual.
Agency code of agency that wrote the arrest report.

resource.name: Sonoma County Sheriff's Office Event Data
resource.description: Event data summarizes Sheriff's dispatch and deputy initiated activities. Events related to the following Penal Codes have been omitted in accordance with the California Public Records Act: 220, 236.1, 243.4, 261, 261.5, 262, 262(a)(1), 264, 264.1, 265, 266, 266(a), 266(b), 266(c), 266(e), 266(f), 266(j), 267, 269, 269(a), 273(a), 273(d), 273.5, 285, 286, 288, 288(a), 288.2, 288.3, 288.5, 288.7, 289, 422.6, 422.7, 422.75, 646.9, 647.6, as well as Welfare and Institutions Code 5150 or Business and Professions Code 729(a) and Stake Out. Additionally canceled events are not reported.
columns_description: Nature of the event that was reported to dispatch.
Incident number if a incident report was written by the responding deputy. This data corresponds to Sonoma County Sheriff's Office Incident data based upon incident number and agency.
Sequential unique identifier, primary key.
Agency code of responding agency
Geographic location of the reported nearest intersection. Entry of coordinates "(0,0)" indicates that the system was unable to identify the geographic location of the event.
Abbreviated version of the event disposition. Disposition is not required data for event data so there are occasionally blanks in this field.
Nature code for event, abbreviated version of nature description.
Disposition of the event as determined by the responding deputy or dispatcher. Disposition is not required data for event data so there are occasionally blanks in this field.

Closest intersection to the location where the event was reported. Intersections are used to protect victims identities. Blank data in this field indicates that the system could not find the nearest intersection to the location of the event.
Source from which the event was created either a call to our dispatch center or an event initiated by a deputy during the course of their work.
Full name of responding agency
Sequential event number assigned by the dispatch system.
Date and time event was created in the dispatch system.

Geographic area where the event occurred, the Sheriff's jurisdiction is currently divided into six zones. Windsor and Sonoma do not use beats/zones. Blanks data in this field indicates the system was unable to identify the zone/beat where the event occurred.

resource.name: Salary Steps by Job Classification
resource.description: Current salary steps (A Step - I Step) and unit designations for all job classifications.
resource.attribution: County of Sonoma Human Resources Department
